item.title: Report E-2025050505
item.description:
Report E-2025050505

Identified by scraper @ 2025-06-22T01:13:25+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-05-20
  • City: GRAND RAPIDS
  • State: MI
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: CLEAN HARBORS ENVIRONMENTAL SERVICES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: The driver was asked to move his truck to allow for another vehicle to get around when he did the driver failed to resecure the dome lid that he had opened to prepare for unloading at 0830 et. When the driver began to move the material sloshed out of the dome lid releasing 10-15 gallon to the pavement. Absorbent was placed down to collect the material and the the absorbent were placed into a container to be disposed of appropriately. The dome lid was then closed properly before moving back into position to off load.

item.title: Report X-2025051863
item.description:
Report X-2025051863

Identified by scraper @ 2025-06-22T01:13:25+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-05-19
  • City: LANSING
  • State: MI
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: RESPONDED TO AN AIR EXPRESS CRITICAL SERVICE PACKAGE THAT WAS COLD TO THE TOUCH. UPON INSPECTION OF THE CONTENTS DISCOVERED APPROXIMATELY THREE POUNDS OF DRY ICE COOLING K9 FROZEN PLATELET CONCENTRATE AND K9 FRESH FROZEN PLASMA. THERE ARE NO DANGEROUS GOODS MARKS OR LABELS ON THE OUTER BOX. THERE IS A RED STICKER APPLIED THAT READS URGENT PERISHABLE, RUSH, FRAGILE, HANDLE WITH CARE, REFRIGERATE, AND DO NOT FREEZE. THIS PACKAGE HAS NOT BEEN ACCEPTED FOR AIR OR TRANSPORTED IN THE AIR BY UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO.

item.title: Report E-2025060260
item.description:
Report E-2025060260

Identified by scraper @ 2025-06-22T01:13:25+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-05-16
  • City: JACKSON
  • State: MI
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: DAYTON FREIGHT LINES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Dayton Freight personnel observed approximately two (2) cups of material released from one (1) 263-gallon poly tote due to an unknown reason causing the tote to leak. The released material impacted the dock floor. Dayton Freight personnel deployed granular absorbents to the impacted area and gathered the spent material and containerized it into one (1) 5-gallon poly drum. The generated waste was staged onsite at the terminal in a secure location. The customer was contacted to see if they still wanted the IBC tote of product because it is no longer leaking. They are awaiting a response. The generated waste will remain onsite for Dayton Freight’s contracted hazardous waste vendor to coordinate disposal.

item.title: Report X-2025051652
item.description:
Report X-2025051652

Identified by scraper @ 2025-06-22T01:13:25+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-05-16
  • City: MADISON HEIGHTS
  • State: MI
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: A PARTIME SUPERVISOR FOUND A LEAKING PACKAGE IN TRAILER AT DOOR 91 AND CALLED FOR A RESPONDER. THE RESONDER ARRIVED TO THE SPILLED PACKAGE WITH PROPER PERSONAL PROTECTIVE EQUIPMENT ON AND DECISION TREE IN HAND. APON ARRIVAL USING THE UPS DECISION TREE, THE RESPONDER DETERMINED THAT THE SPILL WAS A FLAMMABLE LIQUID BY THE RED DIAMOND LABEL. THE RESPONDER CONTAINED SPILL IN A LINED SPILL TRAY AND TRANSPORTED THE LEAKING PACKAGE TO THE DAMAGE MATERIALS AREA FOR FURTHER PROCESSING PER WASTE DISPOSAL FOR A FULL DMP.

item.title: Report E-2025060276
item.description:
Report E-2025060276

Identified by scraper @ 2025-06-22T01:13:25+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-05-14
  • City: WATERFORD TOWNSHIP
  • State: MI
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: DAYTON FREIGHT LINES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Dayton Freight personnel observed approximately one (1) ounce of material released from one (1) 5-gallon steel pail due to a forklift accident that resulted in the pail being punctured. The released material impacted the concrete dock floor. Dayton Freight personnel containerized the damaged drum with the remaining product into one (1) 20-gallon poly drum. The generated waste was staged onsite at the terminal in a secure location. The generated waste will remain onsite for Dayton Freight’s contracted hazardous waste vendor to coordinate disposal.

item.title: Report E-2025060220
item.description:
Report E-2025060220

Identified by scraper @ 2025-06-22T01:13:25+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-05-14
  • City: BYRON CENTER
  • State: MI
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: DAYTON FREIGHT LINES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Dayton Freight personnel observed approximately one (1) gallon of material released from one (1) 5-gallon metal pail. The released material leaked from the pail and impacted the concrete dock floor. Dayton Freight personnel discovered the spilled material had evaporated so there was no reason for absorbents. The impacted pail was containerized into one (1) 10-gallon metal drum. The generated waste was staged onsite at the terminal in a secure location. The generated waste will remain onsite for Dayton Freight’s contracted hazardous waste vendor to coordinate disposal.

item.title: Report E-2025050494
item.description:
Report E-2025050494

Identified by scraper @ 2025-06-22T01:13:25+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-05-09
  • City: ROMULUS
  • State: MI
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO ENTERPRISE SERVICES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 12000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: At 14:56 EST, ERTS was contacted by XPO (XDE) about a cargo release. It was reported that due to a forklift puncture, approximately 30 gallons of 06L04000 CARIBOU HR OPV (hazardous - UN1139) was released. The caller stated that the released product was contained to the trailer floor at dock door #5. The terminal has requested a contractor out for cleanup and containment due to the confined trailer area - without good ventilation a respirator is possibly needed (Paul Flemming - SCM). There were no drains, soils or waterways reported to have been impacted by the release. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 40 gallons of UN1139 06L04000 Caribou HR OPV product was released to entire wooden trailer floor and 60’x15’ concrete beneath trailer due to forklift puncture. The contractors generated (10) drums of impacted oil dri and (2) overpacked drums. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

item.title: Report X-2025060604
item.description:
Report X-2025060604

Identified by scraper @ 2025-06-22T01:13:25+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-05-07
  • City: FLAT ROCK
  • State: MI
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: GRAND TRUNK WESTERN RAILROAD COMPANY
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 18000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On 05/07/2025, a CN transportation employee observed liquid on the side of tank car # DPRX 258989 (Loaded / UN 1117 / Class 3) at the CN Flat Rock Yard located in Flat Rock, MI. Internal emergency response notifications were made to further investigate. The assessment of the tank car revealed that all 6 manway cover swing bolts were found to be less than tool-tight (easily turned by a gloved hand), preventing a proper seal of the manway cover, allowing the contents to leak during transportation. The manway cover was opened for gasket integrity inspection. The manway cover gasket was found to be intact without any noticeable defects. The manway cover swing bolts were properly tightened with a 24' pipe wrench.

item.title: Report E-2025060036

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: At 0114 ET, XPO notified ERTS of a cargo release at terminal XDE. It was reported that approximately 15 gallons of "P70 Primer Weldon" were released from a metal drum due to improper loading and the lid of the drum coming loose. The release impacted the inside of trailer #3213270. ERTS reviewed the SDS with the caller and determined that terminal personnel are capable of cleaning the release with PPE available on site. XPO will place the waste inside of a 20-gallon metal drum. ERTS generated waste ID 236623-1. The original drum will be shipped since it is not damaged.

  • Description: At 10:30 ET, XPO-XGR reported a 0.5-pint release of Convoclean Forte released from three boxes containing two 2-gallon poly jugs each to the trailer floor due to a forklift puncture caused by a previous terminal. ERTS reviewed the SDS with the caller and determined the release could not be cleaned by terminal personnel due to class 8 hazard, the Service Center Manager, gave authorization for terminal personnel to clean up the spill. A Waste ID will be generated.

item.title: Report E-2025050401
item.description:
Report E-2025050401

Identified by scraper @ 2025-06-22T01:13:25+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-04-23
  • City: ROMULUS
  • State: MI
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO ENTERPRISE SERVICES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 7500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: At 0032 ET, XPO notified ERTS of a cargo release at Terminal XDE. It was reported that 10 gallons of “UNKNOWN UN3500” were released from a damaged 1000-pound Cylinder. The release is impacting the trailer floor. ERTS was advised that the trailer has a strong smell and fumes. the Terminal is requesting contractor support to clean the released product and inspect the metal cylinders. ERTS will dispatch a contractor to clean up, inspect, and containerize the release. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 12-gallons of UN3500 Delta-Therm AE 7105 Isocyanate product released from the 1000-pound metal cylinder to 15’x8’ wooden trailer floor and 2’x2’ area of concrete due to valve was open from strap that got hung up on it when tightened. The crew cleaned the release using granular absorbents and rags and placed them into (1) 55-gallon metal drum along with PPE. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

item.title: Report E-2025050399
item.description:
Report E-2025050399

Identified by scraper @ 2025-06-22T01:13:25+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-04-21
  • City: ZEELAND
  • State: MI
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO ENTERPRISE SERVICES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: At 0937 ET, XPO notified ERTS of a cargo release at customer location in Zealand, MI It was reported that approximately 2 gallons of BIOCIDE 3750W released from 1) 55-gallon poly drum due to shipper packing. The release impacted trailer # 4632281. ERTS will proceed to dispatch a contractor to the site to complete cleanup activities. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 2-cup release of UN3286 Biocide 3750W which impacted a 1’x1’ area of the trailer floor and 1’x1’ area of the asphalt below the trailer. The crew overpacked the 55-gallon poly drum into a 95-gallon poly drum. The release was then cleaned using oil dri which was worked in, then containerized into a 55-gallon poly drum. The waste was taken to XPO terminal where it will be staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.
